intro: Randia retroflexa, commonly known as the redroot stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Randia retroflexa is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in some areas.
